findCenterHelpTitle: Need Help Finding a Center Near You?
findCenterHelpIntro: Finding the right support can be hard — but Google can make it easier.
findCenterStep1: Open Google Maps or Google.com on your phone or computer.
findCenterStep2: Search for terms like 'Autism therapy center near me', 'Speech therapy in [your city]'.
findCenterStep3: Look for good ratings, contact info, and services like ABA, OT, or speech therapy.

aboutAutismSteps.title: 🧠 What is Autism?
aboutAutismSteps.text: Autism is a developmental condition that affects how a child communicates, learns, behaves, and interacts with others. Every child with autism is different – it’s called a “spectrum” because it includes a wide range of strengths and challenges.

aboutAutismSteps.title: 🧠 Autism is a Difference, Not a Disease
points: Autism is not a disease. It’s a neurological difference.
Children with autism may see, hear, feel, and interact with the world differently than others.
With love, patience, and support, many children on the autism spectrum grow up to live happy and meaningful lives.

aboutAutismSteps.title: 🧩 Common Signs of Autism in Children
aboutAutismSteps.text: Here are some early signs parents might observe in children with autism.

aboutAutismSteps.title: 👁️ Social & Communication Differences
points: Limited eye contact or facial expressions
Delay in speaking or not speaking at all
Prefers to play alone, doesn’t join group play
May not understand gestures, tone of voice, or facial cues

aboutAutismSteps.title: 🔄 Repetitive Behavior
points: Repeats certain actions or words again and again (stimming)
Has strict routines or gets upset by small changes
Shows strong interest in specific topics, objects, or activities

aboutAutismSteps.title: 👂 Sensory Sensitivities
points: Very sensitive to sounds, lights, touch, or smells
May react strongly to textures or certain foods

aboutAutismSteps.title: 💛 Remember
points: Autism is not anyone’s fault – it is just a different way of growing up.
Early support can make a big difference.
Your love, understanding, and patience are the most powerful tools in helping your child.

AutismTerms.title: Fine Motor Skills
AutismTerms.text: Movements using small muscles of the hands and fingers.
AutismTerms.Why it matters: Helps in daily tasks like writing, dressing, and picking up small objects.
AutismTerms.Example: Holding a crayon, buttoning a shirt.

AutismTerms.title: Gross Motor Skills
AutismTerms.text: Movements involving large muscle groups — such as legs, arms, and core.
AutismTerms.Why it matters: These help with balance, posture, and overall physical development.

AutismTerms.title: Sensory Play
AutismTerms.text: Activities that stimulate the senses — touch, smell, sight, sound, and movement.
AutismTerms.Why it matters: Helps children regulate their sensory input and stay calm.
AutismTerms.Example: Playing with sand, water, textured balls.

AutismTerms.title: Visual Schedule
AutismTerms.text: A picture-based routine to help children know what’s next.
AutismTerms.Why it matters: Provides structure, reduces anxiety, and improves understanding.
AutismTerms.Example: A chart showing ‘Brush teeth → Eat breakfast → School’.

AutismTerms.title: Stimming
AutismTerms.text: Repetitive behaviors used to self-regulate emotions or focus.
AutismTerms.Why it matters: It's a natural way many autistic individuals calm themselves.
AutismTerms.Example: Hand flapping, spinning, repeating words or sounds.

hero.heading: Together, We Thrive
hero.intro:
Created by parents, for parents—this platform brings together India’s autism resources in one place. From regional-language guides and therapy center listings to practical tools, everything is designed to help you spend less time searching and more time supporting your child’s journey.

**Our goal is simple:**

- **Educate** families and communities about autism.
- **Support** parents at every step of their journey.
- **Connect** families with regional resources and language support.
- **Reach** parents in remote areas who may not have access to therapies and guidance.

Together, we aim to build a caring, inclusive space where every parent feels supported and every child’s potential is celebrated.

udidGuide.title: UDID (Unique Disability ID) Application Guide
udidGuide.whatIs: UDID is a digital ID card issued by the Government of India for individuals with disabilities. It centralizes disability data and enables access to multiple schemes and benefits.
benefits: Single national ID for all disability-related services.
Required for most schemes (Niramaya, Samarth, pension, etc.).
Tracks history and benefits across states and programs.
udidGuide.eligibility: Medical certification of disability (including Autism Spectrum Disorder under RPWD Act 2016).
howToApply: Visit the official UDID portal: https://www.swavlambancard.gov.in
Register using Aadhaar, contact info, and upload medical certificate.
Fill disability details and attach supporting documents (photo, ID).
After medical board verification, digital & physical UDID card is issued.
